hints.content:
$\goldE{?}+ 393 = 706$

![A number line with 2 points labeled. An arrow from point 393 to point 706 is labeled, plus question mark.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5c59ef9812c0af0117360d3d0b1cba6c9ac6d1c6)

Let's start by adding hundreds to ${393}$ until we get as close to  ${706}$ as possible without going over ${706}$.

$\begin{align}
{393} +\purpleD{100}=493\\\\
{493} +\purpleD{100}= 593\\\\
{593} +\purpleD{100}= 693
\end{align}$

If we add $\purpleD{3 \text{ hundreds}}$, or $\purpleD{3 00}$, we reach $693$. We cannot add any more hundreds without going over ${706}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 393 to a new point 693 labeled, "plus 300"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/d65d1ff0d0c17242b798414a6665ece68616a6c6)

Next, let's add tens to $693$ until we get as close to  ${706}$ as possible without going over ${706}$.

$\begin{align}
693 +\blueD{10}=703
\end{align}$

If we add $\blueD{1 \text{ ten}}$, or $\blueD{10}$, we reach $703$. We cannot add any more tens without going over ${706}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 693 to a new point 703 labeled, "plus 10"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a7a8913a20912abfc24fe36b0e7bb161deda9b6f)

Finally, how many ones should we add to  $703$ to get to  ${706}?$

$703 +\greenD{3}={706}$

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 703 to point 706 labeled, "plus 3"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/235b99542739a4e2be90f4c3d64edaa570cc4d29)

We added $\purpleD{3 \text{ hundreds}}$, $\blueD{1 \text{ ten}}$, and $\greenD{3\text{ ones}}$ to ${393}$ to get to ${706}$.

$\purpleD{3 00}+\blueD{1 0}+\greenD{3}=\goldE{313}$

![The number line with all of the arrows shown. The original arrow from point 393 to point 706 is labeled, "plus 313." The arrows spans the arrows labeled "plus 300," "plus 10," and "plus 3."](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/18c440a298109efb2e9ca18390db77cae1c42606)

question.content:
**What number makes this equation true?** 

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] ${} + 393 =706$
